alert.note: Alert for Boone; Bracken; Campbell; Gallatin; Grant; Kenton; Owen; Pendleton; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 11:45AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, ROBERTSON, KENTON, WESTERN BRACKEN, CAMPBELL, BOONE, GRANT, SOUTHEASTERN OWEN, PENDLETON AND EASTERN GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM EDT... At 1145 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rising Sun to near Dry Ridge to 10 miles south of Williamstown to 12 miles northwest of Georgetown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Covington, Florence, Independence, Erlanger, Edgewood, Alexandria, Elsmere, Fort Mitchell, Highland Heights, Taylor Mill, Fort Wright, Williamstown, Walton, Crestview Hills, Lakeside Park, Rising Sun, Falmouth, Oakbrook, Burlington and Claryville. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 67 and 77. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 144 and 185. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
